The Signature Matching layer in the dataplane is responsible for pattern matching to detect and block known threats, such as spyware and vulnerability exploits. This layer uses predefined signatures and the Single Pass Pattern Match mechanism to efficiently inspect traffic for malicious patterns.

Selected Answer: A
Palo Alto Networks regularly updates its threats and application databases. Updates include new antivirus and
spyware definitions, new malicious domains and URLs, and new application signatures.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
If you have configured an authentication sequence, the firewall checks against each profile in sequence until one profile successfully authenticates the user.
[Palo Alto Networks]

Selected Answer: A
Local should be put first in that sequence.

Same with AAA, same with Switches and Routers. Answer = A 
You need a 1,2,3 choice in a list.

Answer=A
PCNSA 2021, page 107
Authentication Sequence Admin Roles for external administrator accounts can be assigned to an Authentication Sequence, which includes a sequence of one or more Authentication Profiles that are processed in a specific order. The firewall checks against each Authentication Profile within the Authentication Sequence until one Authentication Profile successfully authenticates the user.

questions.question_text: Which interface type uses virtual routers and routing protocols?
Which URL Filtering Profile action does not generate a log entry when a user attempts to access a URL?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I wanted to update the url for the source of the answer:
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering/administration/url-filtering-basics/url-filtering-profiles

" allow: The website is allowed and no log entry is generated.
NOTE: Don’t set allow as the Action for categories of traffic you don’t block because you lose visibility into traffic you don’t log. Instead, set alert as the Action for categories of traffic you don’t block to log and provide visibility into the traffic. "
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/policy/security-profiles

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B
"allow traffic destined for that URL category; allowed traffic is not logged."

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/url-filtering/configure-url-filtering.html

correct answer is B
"allow traffic destined for that URL category; allowed traffic is not logged."

https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/url-filtering/configure-url-filtering.html

It should be B - ALLOW. 
If you read the below url, and it's clear only Allow will not generate any log.
I believe that both for Continue and Override a log entry is not generated unless the user persists to actually go to the website, nevertheless, Allow is the best answer.
